intro: Ageratinastrum, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, blue or purple flower clusters that resemble mist, giving it its common name. Ageratinastrum typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
